meanings.definition: Compellers: those who compel or force someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The compellers in the story made the character do things against their will.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speeches were the compellers that pushed him to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent3: The compellers at the party were the friends who convinced him to dance on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were the compellers that drew him in, unable to look away.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules acted as compellers for the students to complete their assignments on time.

meanings.definition: Compellers: things that compel or drive someone to take action
meanings.sent1: The exciting plot twists in the book were the compellers that kept him reading late into the night.
meanings.sent2: The smell of freshly baked cookies was the compellers that led him to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The compellers in the movie were the suspenseful music and unexpected plot twists.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery acted as compellers, urging him to explore the unknown forest.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message on his phone served as a compeller for him to leave work immediately.
